That POW schemes waste work in some way misunderstands basic economics.  @truthcoin explains it [here](http://www.truthcoin.info/blog/pow-cheapest/).
@bot Did you read the link I posted?

I think that the fact that people are willing to exchange BTC for goods and services is a very positive outcome and worth the "wasted" electricity.  As long as users are free to mine as much as they want, they will mine until the cost of new equipment, electricity, etc. exceeds the value of additional mined coins.  In order to have a system where nobody makes large mining investments, you either need to force people to limit the scope of their mining or else make sure that the coins are worthless.  The main problem for Bitcoin decentralization is that when it was first designed, nobody thought it would be possible for such a small group of players to pay for all the hashing.  Conclusion: BTC mining is not "wasteful" enough!
